item.title: Mittens and Metaphysic â€” Product Atheism and Vekllei object-form
item.description: Archived from the original article here ðŸŒ¼ Featured in the Atlantic This article appeared in Issue #6 of the Atlantic Bulletin. You can read it here. Pictured above: various fashions worn by Vekllei women, showcasing heavy cold-weather dresses, simple styling, strong geometric shapes and colours, loose fits, and modest hemlines. Pictured below: postmodern neomarxism, which Iâ€™ve tricked you into reading with anime. Previous posts on the Vekllei economy, if youâ€™re new:

item.title: Road Trip
item.description: Archived from the original article here ðŸŒ¼ Featured in the Atlantic This article appeared in Issue #5 of the Atlantic Bulletin. You can read it here. They showed up at the autopool, and someone had just returned a brand new AAAC Voya Voya â€” incredible. It was like Christ himself had blessed them. It only (barely) seat five, and there were six of them, but it wasnâ€™t a problem.

item.title: Police in Vekllei
item.description: Archived from the original article here ðŸŒ¼ Featured in the Atlantic This article appeared in Issue #3 of the Atlantic Bulletin. You can read it here. There are two regular police organs in Vekllei. Fedecenoayan porits (national police, or venopor) Comoisniyan denporitsa (local police, or cosmopor) A young venopor officer stands on the left, in the full street regalia theyâ€™re renowned for. Unlike cosmopor, they often carry machine guns while on patrol and are stationed outside of government buildings, hospitals, train stations, ports, schools and any company managed directly by a bureau, which is a trade organ of national importance.

item.title: A Map of Vekllei â€” 100 Boroughs; 100 Hearts
item.description: Archived from the original article here ðŸŒ¼ Featured in the Atlantic This article appeared in Issue #2 of the Atlantic Bulletin. You can read it here. Map Key Red: Magjet trains, 750km/h Yellow: Bullet trains, 300-400km/h Orange: Regional trains, <150km/h Brown: Local trains, including limited express, <100km/h Blue: National highway Dashed: Ferry line Green: tarmacadamed airport The largest division of any portion of Vekllei land is the borough; a region of varying size and population with common culture, food dependency and economic interest.

item.title: The Vekllei Crown â€” coins of a moneyless country
item.description: Archived from the original article here ðŸŒ¼ Featured in the Atlantic This article appeared in Issue #2 of the Atlantic Bulletin. You can read it here. Vekllei, legendarily, does not use circulate currency. Goods and services are moved and offered arbitrarily, provided amply in abundance. Anything that is not abundant is manufactured and distributed directly under the control of a bureau, which is a trade organ responsible to the affairs of the country.

item.title: Village Map of Montre-Lola
item.description: Archived from the original article here ðŸŒ¼ Featured in the Atlantic This article appeared in Issue #2 of the Atlantic Bulletin. You can read it here. The village of Montre-Lola is home to about 400 people in its entirety, a stoneâ€™s throw from the Aisyo borough. Each morning, however, the population swells as 300 children from tiny villages in both Aisyo and Montre take a fast tram to the Montre-Lola Area School No.

item.title: The Oa-Class Battlecruiser
item.description: Archived from the original article here ðŸŒ¼ Featured in the Atlantic This article appeared in Issue #2 of the Atlantic Bulletin. You can read it here. Veklleiâ€™s defensive military posture has, in doctrine and arms development, limited its ability to meaningfully project power outside of the Atlantic. As an island nation with a large and multifaceted naval armada, the Oa-Class Battlecruiser is the heart of her armed forces, as the flagship of her fleets.

item.title: The Chemical Feast
item.description: Archived from the original article here ðŸŒ¼ Featured in the Atlantic This article appeared in Issue #1 of the Atlantic Bulletin. You can read it here. East of Montre, West of Tjornes, waits a rare sight among Veklleiâ€™s hard igneous slopes â€” a crown of gentle sedimentary cliffs packed with ruddy sandstone, which melt glacially into the sea chasing blue-sky bergs. Tzipora was, at the time, making her way on foot from Montre-Lola to Ada, which was a coastal town in the North-East known for its luxurious health spas.

item.title: Veklleiâ€™s Elite Military Units â€” the Garden Corps and their bloody war against weeds
item.description: Archived from the original article here ðŸŒ¸ Archived Post This article predates the project, and should be considered non-canon. Previous post On Tuesday, two casualties were reported among Veklleiâ€™s Folifedestarmie 24th and 25th Garden Companies in the ongoing war to make the capitalâ€™s parks the finest in the world. Michael Helen-Louisviuan cut his leg on an exposed nail during the deinstallation of old fence posts, and Ana Po cut her thumb on a rose.
